map.legendDescription: Does livestock antibiotic use exceed suggested cap of 50mg/PCU?

title: Does livestock antibiotic use exceed suggested target?
subtitle: Antibiotics are used in livestock for animal health and productivity, but also pose a risk for antibiotic resistance in both humans and livestock. Although not legally-binding, many countries have set targets to reduce antibiotic use to 50 milligrams per kilogram of meat production (50mg/PCU).
sourceDesc: European Medicines Agency, European Surveillance of Veterinary Antimicrobial Consumption (2017) & Van Boeckel et al. (2015)
